Share: Digg Facebook StumbleUpon More 2003 Crop Formations in Germany © 2003 by Linda Moulton Howe May 20, 2003 Isle of Rugen, Germany - Invisiblecircle.de is reporting five crop formations in Germany as of May 18, 2003. All five are on the Isle of Rugen in the Baltic Sea at the far most eastern corner of Germany. In 2002, most of Germany's formations were also on the Isle of Rugen which is an island 35 miles long and 25 miles wide with 400-foot-high chalk cliffs and covered with ancient burial mounds and stone circles. Isle of Rugen in the Baltic Sea at the far most eastern corner of Germany, 35 miles long and 25 miles wide. All five formations have been in yellow flowering oilseed rape such as the field below near the village of Scharpitz discovered on May 10. In fact, four of the five formations so far have been near Scharpitz; the first on May 1 was discovered near Altefahr. As in previous years of formations on the Isle of Rugen, the patterns in 2003 are variations on circles, corridors and concentric rings. Two crop patterns in foreground were discovered on May 10, 2003, in yellow flowering oilseed rape near the village of Scharpitz on Germany's Isle of Rugen. Photograph © 2003 by Frank Laumen.

Corridor and circle point north. Diagram © 2003 by Jan Schwochow. Closer aerial over the May 10, 2003 patterns near Scharpitz, Isle of Rugen. Photograph © 2003 by Frank Laumen. Diagrams of 2003 Germany Formations: May 18, 2003 in Scharpitz, Isle of Rugen, Germany. Diagram © 2003 by Jan Schwochow. May 17, 2003 in Scharpitz, Isle of Rugen, Germany. May 1, 2003 in Altefahr, Isle of Rugen, Germany.
